alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 8:14AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Kanawha, east central Lincoln and northern Boone Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 813 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Julian, or 8 miles northeast of Madison, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Pratt, Coal Fork, Alum Creek, Julian, Tornado, Danville, Handley and Seth. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 99. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 52 and 54. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 71 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 53 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
